column4: Do I have to do anything special with Ubuntu to use CIFS?  Or should it work out of the box?
Ok, I am having trouble.  I am trying to mount a shared drive I have on Windows.  I created it on C:\Photos and shared it, giving read/write permissions
check smbmount
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/MountWindowsSharesPermanently
its not cifs with windows
if its not linux to linux its samba
the link tells you all
id use that, its all on the post i gave you
in the link you gave me they have you editing your fstab file but the type of mount in it is "cifs" - I thought cifs couldn't access windows?
thats my understanding, mind you that link is the official documentation. id stick with that
http://www.justlinux.com/nhf/Filesystems/Mounting_smbfs_Shares_Permanently.html
ps -ef | grep -i samba
it shows "1001 5253 5194 0 12:27 tty1 00:00:00 grep -i samba .." does that mean it is running?
thats the pid of the command you just ran
nothing else showed up
yu only need to run samba on the system to share files from yuor linux system if memory serves
yes, I am also trying to do that
i thought you were mounting the windows partition?
oic, then you need sudo apt-get install samba
sudo apt-get update; sudo apt-get install samba
then the repo is down
here's my hardy repos http://pastebin.com/f4323076e
